titleStmt.title: George W. Kinsor et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4343

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Gov of the Commonwealth of Ky. Your petitioner George W Kinsor would most respectfully represent into your Excellency, that at the April Term 1862, of the Knox Circuit Court, he was indicted for the offense of "Keeping a Tipling House" and at the September Term 1863 of the Knox Circuit Court he appeared in open court and plead guilty to said charge whereupon a fine of $60 was assed against him. He says that the facts in said case are about as follows that just a short time before the finding of the indictment he moved to this Knox Co Ky from Tennessee, and purchased a farm upon which was a "Tavern Stand" and afterwards bought some liquors with a view to go to tavern keeping, that when he was ready to procur his license, the County Judge of Knox Co Ky and every resident lawyer was absent from the County in consequence of rebel invasion, and he could not obtain any legal advice upon the matter that he advised with a justice of the Peace, who advised him that he could sell liquor untill a County Court was held and there procur his license, and all would be right, that he did obtain his license at the first court held, but had sold liquors before. He acted upon the advice of the Justice supposing he knew the law He says that he has always endeavored to be obedient to the laws that he is a loyal man and an obedient citizen the premises considered he prays that your Excellency
may extend to him the arm of your Executive clemency and remit the fine as aforesaid
Sworn to before me by George W Kinsor October 1863
We the undersigned would like to see your Excellency remit the fine against Mr Kinsor

F. P. Stickley
J. W. Anderson
Jas T Goshen
R Herndon
J. W. Ridgell
W. B. Anderson
Wm Tuggle
Thomas G. Pitzer
M. M. Pope P. J. R. C. C
Alfred Tinsley Clk R. C. C
J. W. Davis M. H. Regt
John Brogmes

Knox Cir Court
vs
George W Kinsor
Petition

Remit all except fees & costs
Oct 24th 1863
Tho Bramlette
